Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: TXMom82
Reviews.Content: Maybe my expections were too high for our experience. Our bedding on the pull out couch was dirty with crumbs from not being changed I am assuming. No pillows or blanket was provided for the pull out and when we asked for fresh bedding and pillows it never arrived. The beds were uncomfortable and the front desk staff blew us off to someone else everytime we asked them something about the area. Our breakfast was good and the staff there was very nice. The most negative thing about this hotel was out of my own stupidity. I left my Coach purse after switching purses and didn't realize it until the evening after our departure when unpacking. Upon contacting them with all information about what it was in and the description of the purse their response was I couldn't prove anything and their staff states nothing was left in the room. I didn't expect them to be honest, but it would have been nice!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful retreat”
Reviews.Author: LWirth
Reviews.Content: Had a one night layover in Phoenix and wasn't expecting much but this hotel was a pleasant surprise. It was clean and spacious, the staff was friendly and helpful, and the room was large and spacious. We took a dip in the pool which was lovely and provided towels down in the pool area. Not only were we surprised by the omelette station at breakfast but happy hour too!! Also had a wonderful dinner at the hillstone grille which is pretty much in the parking lot of this hotel. A wonderful experience. The kids loved the koi fish and were even given fish food by the front desk to feed them. We also loved all the facts placed strategically around while we navigated the ponds in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoYankee
Reviews.Content: When you think of Embassy Suites the spacious suites, large Atrium setting, and fantastic breakfast come to mind and this one is no different. This hotel is on the older side so if your spoiled by new hotels I could see how this may disappoint. I had trouble connecting to the internet but maybe it was just me. Next time I visit I may stay in a differerent area just to be closer to more restaurants and shopping as this Biltmore location seems to have seen its better days.

Reviews.Title: “Very good full service hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TicketandGo
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night's stay at the Embassy Suites Hotel in Phoenix-Biltmore. It was an exceptional good value, got it on HHonors Points and Money. We received the requested room (double, pool view) with a present waiting in the living room, a gift basket with Popcorn and free bottled water. The cooked to order omelettes at the breakfast buffet are really good, great selection otherwise and it's FREE! Another perk is Embassy's FREE Manager's Reception from 5.30 to 7.30pm. Any drink you like with appetizers! Pool very well maintained and located. The atrium is an eye-catcher. Hotel location is another plus, close to a very nice mall with great restaurants, Safeway is also close by. Do not book if you want a free airport shuttle since they do not serve the airport, shuttle only available within a 3 mil radius!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased with our entire stay!”
Reviews.Author: B T
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Phoenix for our anniversary. We chose to stay at the Embassy Suites Phoenix/Biltmore, based on other reviews here on Trip Advisor. We were very pleased with our entire stay. Our daughter picked us up at the airport, as there is not shuttle service to/from the airport. We even chose NOT to rent a vehicle while we were there, as we were within walking distance to the Biltmore Shopping/Dining area. We even walked to our anniversary dinner at Christopher's ( a nice French cuisine restaurant). It was lovely... The room was great...The first part of the room was a little "living room/dining room" that had a couch, table and chairs, and little mini fridge and microwave and sink. Beyond a door was the bathroom and the queen bed, and a sink/mirror...Beyond this area was the balcony. We were on the 4th floor, and the balcony accommodated one, maybe two chairs, but would not fit a table...One or two of the lower levels had a "full" balcony that allowed for a nice sized round table and chairs; adequate for dining. ***The only downfall of having a level lower than 4, is that the pool hours are until MIDNIGHT. Since we were able to hear people VERY well, in the pool area, late at night, I can only imagine that it would prevent, especially light sleepers and children, from sleeping at a normal hour. I would greatly comment to management to end pool hours by 10 or even 11pm, to have respect for those who would appreciate "quiet hours" at a reasonable time. :) The staff/management/housekeeping, were ALL very kind and helpful. The room was very clean and the room temperature was controlled by US. There was an adjustable thermostat in our room The koi pond and greenery inside was beautiful. The pool area, trees/landscape etc. were lovely. We really enjoyed our stay here, and would go back in a moment! We enjoyed the breakfast options, that were more than any "free" breakfast we had ever experienced, at ANY hotel! The egg omelets were FABULOUS! We were able to choose from mushrooms, tomatoes, jalapenos, cheese, spinach, onions, ham, or ALL OF THE ABOVE. Potatoes were also available with the omelets. There were many other breakfast options: pancakes, oatmeal, fresh fruit, cereal....There were also a few tables outside to enjoy the morning sun, while eating. We SO enjoyed that, each day! The manager's reception in the early evening provided a free drink: alcoholic or otherwise, and a light snack.

Reviews.Title: “good location, expect what you are expecting”
Reviews.Author: isildor
Reviews.Content: The best part of the hotel is its location. An average embassy suites stay, unless you really enjoy lots of plants around lobby and intertwined ponds or glass elevators. Most generous breakfast that can get crowded in high season. Same with pool, no luck this time in finding a lounge chair or a towel. I did enjoy the sound of birds that made us feel in warm temperate weather again, as we came in from NW. I would stay away from pool side rooms; noise goes on till late at night; quiet time not till midnight and people screamed every night, either kids or adults on beer. We were able to drown noise by turning fan/ac in room which makes a nice steady sound.The hotel is located across street from upscale Biltmore Shopping Centre, which has plenty to see and shop, whether clothes or food and even an outdoor movie night. Although the hotel doesn't quite compare to its neighboring shopping centre, especially the lobby and common areas that haven't been remodeled for a while, (our room had). We had a comfortable suite w/ 2 convenient sinks, microwave and fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Pool Views and Queues”
Reviews.Author: Retyree
Reviews.Content: The Embassy Suites Phoenix Biltmore has a stunning lobby and atrium (see pic). We stayed 5 nights while touring Arizona. At first very annoyed over not getting our pool-view room (booked months before and confirmed 48 hours earlier, by them!), the hotel got it right for our second night and agreed to refund the cost of the first night, spent in a dingy conference-set room. Right decision and good customer relations! The suite was large, well-equipped and had a very small balcony overlooking the pool. Some rooms had a large balcony with table and chairs - not sure how much more than our already high price you have to pay to get one of those! The pool was superb but open far too late too allow noisy people to keep us awake until midnight. Why? The hotel is some 8 miles from the (unexciting) downtown but located a 2-minute walk from the Biltmore Plaza outdoor mall with upmarket shops and expensive restaurants. Also, strangely not promoted at all, across the road (via a safe, well-lit tunnel) is a 14-screen AMC cinema with BRILLIANT dine-while-watching options. A bargain $9 for a superb leather reclining seat and table and a great food and drink menu, served at your seat. We had room service once, which was fast but mediocre. The usual Embassy Suites breakfast and manager's reception drinks/snacks were included, but marred by ridiculous queues as the evening reception bargirl struggled, with a smile, on her own to serve hundreds and the superb and easy breakfast buffet provided at the weekend was repllaced by cook-to-order only on the weekdays. This angered people for no good reason as we waited up to 45 minutes for breakfast. Why? But for this, we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Faith restored in Embassy Suites!”
Reviews.Author: mbaTravels A
Reviews.Content: After a very disappointing stay in El Paso earlier this month i was thrilled my the service, condition, and location of this hotel. Well located for all Phoenix has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Two bedroom? one bedroom? Helicopter?”
Reviews.Author: BRLArgentina
Reviews.Content: Our reservation said 2 bedroom suite. They gave us room 545, a one bedroom suite with 2 beds and a sofa bed. When complied about the 2 bedroom suite they said that they call it 2 bedroom because it has a bedroom and a living room (????). Our room was facing some kind of engine that didn't stop working all night long, and it was like sleeping inside an helicopter because of the noise. They don't have safe in the rooms, so you have to leave your stuff on a safe at the front desk. That shows how oudated is the hotel. The lobby of the hotel looks nice, and the breakfast is good, but the room is relly outdated and they lie about the 2 bedroom suite.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: CaneRidgeJohnny
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights, combination business and fun trip. Pricier than places we normally stay, but it was nice. Huge king suite rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonbly good deal”
Reviews.Author: suebob
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel several times, and it remains the same. The rooms are a typical layout with a bedroom area and a "living room" area. The rooms are large, but bathrooms are very small. Lighting is good; there are lots of outlets and plenty of space to spread out. A real negative on this trip was the lack of temperature control -- some people found their rooms very warm, and some very cold with no way to alter the temperature. Those who complained to the front desk were told that they couldn't change anything -- at least one person got a space heater. There is a complementary breakfast that is well above average, with someone there to make custom omelets. There is also a complementary cocktail hour with some minimal snacks. The hotel is located across the street from an up-scale mini-mall with green space that is good for people watching. The mall also has several very good restaurants. There were lots of pillows, but they were all identical and not to my liking.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, depending on what you want....”
Reviews.Author: DenverDoctorMom
Reviews.Content: Came here for a meeting. Location demands transportation if you want to get anywhere, but they do have a shuttle with a willing driver for short stops. There is a nice shopping area within a few hundred yards that is fairly upscale and also has several eating establishments. The hotel staff were lovely on check-in and very pleasant at every step. The rooms are a typical Embassy Suites two-room unit, with ample space (BIG bedroom and decent living area). The bathroom is small and I definitely didn't appreciate the hair that wasn't mine in the tub and shower on check in. Otherwise, toiletries were reasonable, the towels are large and fluffy. The cotton robe was a nice touch, and the dresser space was great. A second sink in the bedroom would be useful for a family staying together, but isn't necessary for solo travelers....definitely gives you an option if there are several of you traveling together. The included buffet breakfast and made-to-order omelet bar every morning was lovely, and in many circumstances, would save a family $50 or more in breakfast costs. A large pond with beautiful Koi is certainly a nice touch that doesn't happen in most large chains. The fitness facility is quite small and located on the second floor, essentially in the space in between the hallway/atrium. All in all, this is a fine place to be, although somewhat in need of cleaner carpets and bathrooms in my particular experience.

Reviews.Title: “excellent customer service and great amenities”
Reviews.Author: curiousqueries
Reviews.Content: As I travel all the time, I won't take the time to write a review unless the hotel was really great or just terrible. I stayed here for a conference as the Biltmore Arizona resort rooms were full. Although, the Embassy Suites were not as fancy or nice as the Biltmore - they had a nice property, the suites were very large and well-decorated and clean - relatively quiet. There is a pool and whirlpool. The front desk staff - especially manager Valerie and Amanda at the front desk were fantastic. There was a complimentary shuttle to the Biltmore and anywhere within a 3 mile radius and the staff were incredibly friendly. The customized omelette station and complimentary breakfasts were great. The manager's happy hour with food and drink were also wonderful complimentary perks. The staff bent over backwards to help us and make sure we had a great stay. They even sent a town car complimentarily to get us when we finished hiking Squaw Peak and it was dark and we needed to get back - instead of having us wait for the shuttle - which was really appreciated. The property makes sense and is reasonable in price and well-located. There are a bunch of running trails along the canal, hiking to Squaw Peak or Camelback Mountain are close by and really worth it, it backs the golf course and is about a mile from the Biltmore Resort. Of course - it is right beside the mall where there are tons of great restaurant - including True Food Kitchen which was great. The hotel restaurant was reasonable also but not likely something you would like to eat at every night unless you love steak. All in all would definately stay here again. The customer service was great. It made sense and we loved the stay here and would stay at Embassy Suites as a priority above other hotels. It makes sense and is non-pretentious but delivers good quality and good service. What more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: Susan K
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights for Fiesta Bowl. Easy to find and in a lovely neighborhood with high end shopping center across the street. It is an older Embassy Suites but nicely kept up. The only disappointments were the two double beds rather than two queen beds and the air conditioner which clicked on and off loudly all night long. Room did have two sinks (one in bedroom area) which was nice but we did have to call for extra towels the second day (only provided two when their were three people in room). We also had some noise early in the morning from nearby construction but that was not hotel's fault. Breakfast was a little chaotic due to large crowds and they ran out of things like napkins on the first day. Seemed a little unprepared. The second day a manager seemed to be helping and it was better. Wish hotels would extend their breakfast hours for large crowds and special events especially during the week instead of running their normal hours. The Omaha Steakhouse was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, average Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: bonniep71
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent 3 nights at the Embassy Suites Phoenix last week. The lobby is attractive, pool decent size but not interesting and pull-out couch mattress was the worst I have ever experienced. Employees were all very nice and responded well to any request. Breakfast was standard Embassy Suites fare but instead of a hot buffet with an omelet station, it was one woman working as a short order cook. She did a great job, eggs cooked to order, pancakes cooked to order, french toast cooked to order, potatoes hot off the grill......the line was insanely long the first day we were there but smaller on subsequent days. It's not a great setup to say the least. Overall, good value for the money if you are a family staying in one room and utilize breakfast and happy hour.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but Great Ammenties and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Matt H
Reviews.Content: First I'd just like to say the blue-collar staff at this hotel are fantastic. The desk workers, maids, cooks, servers etc really go above and beyond the call of duty. Kudos to them and management for hiring a great bunch. The interior of the hotel is gorgeous, from the koi ponds to the palm trees to the workout room, everything looks and feels good. Made to order free breakfast and nightly free happy hour drinks are excellent amenities. I'm taking one star off because when you pay this much for a hotel, and one that has no problem giving more expensive perks (drinks, breakfast, etc) paying $15 a day to access wireless Internet is silly. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: David_Ferrie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Embassy Suites from 10th to 14th December and on the whole I was pleased with the service and room. All of the staff I had contact with were very helpful & friendly. I ate in my room 3 nights, the room service menu offered a good selection and the person who delivered my meal had the fore thought to include a glass of ice when I ordered sodas. The room was well presented, clean and during my stay it was cleaned well each day. I did at times find that the room was a little cold and the aircon didn't seem to heat it. My only problem was that my room faced onto the car park for the adjacent shopping mall and each morning between 5.30am and 6am there was noise, which I believe was trash being brought out of the hotel for collection. This was a small thing but if you are a light sleeper try avoid rooms facing onto the car park. I reckon all that is required to solve the noise issue would be to replace the sliding door in the bedroom that leads to a small balcony with one that is double glazed. I certainly wouldn't have a problem staying at the hotel again. The breakfasts which are cooked to order were very tasty and really set you up for the day.

Reviews.Title: “The most luxurious embassy suites ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ayayitstiffany
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just wonderful for couples and families with kids. There is a beautiful huge outdoor pool, work out room, mouth watering steak house, delicious and healthy free breakfast buffet, luxurious rooms, the hotel looks like an oasis inside, koi ponds, and very friendly staff. The best part about this hotel is it's location because it is only 10minutes away from Scotsdale, is right next to a mall full of designer clothing stores and grand restaurants, and is about 10-15minutes away from downtown Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location, good service”
Reviews.Author: JMalan23
Reviews.Content: First time staying here, will likely stay again. We love the location-close to Scottsdale, only about 15 minutes front the airport. It's across from a nice mall with Macy's and many other stores and restaurants. My husband's family lives there so we visit often and have stayed other places that were mediocre. He had stayed at the ES Biltmore years ago when it was something else, and it was fabulous then. So, we gave it a try knowing it was at least 20 plus years old and hopefully renovated. we stayed four nights. Our room was typical ES but updated nicely-LR, BR, one bath,granite throughout. The coffee maker, MW, and fridge worked fine. The beds were in good shape. bath was clean, though the inside door frame had a little rust on the bottom. So the first night we were there (thurs), loud music played in the bar area until I don't know when; we fell asleep at 10pm after travel from the east coast. ES rooms open up into an interior courtyard. The other nights were quieter. The food in the hotel restaurant Omaha Steakhouse was delicious! The place was deserted, but I think this was a slow period. Other reviews is had read of itwere good so we tried it and weren't disappointed. We also ate the free breakfast twice and were satisfied. All in all, I was happy with what we got for the money.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: DINKsTravelGuide
Reviews.Content: The pros - Great location, just a few minutes' walk to Biltmore Fashion Park Big rooms, great for families or just being comfortable Complimentary happy hour and hot breakfast are great Super friendly and accomodating staff Big pool that's heated in winter The cons - The rooms are sorely in need of renovation: Small bathrooms, aged carpet, popcorn ceilings (!). Our room smelled of smoke, interesting since indoor smoking has been banned in AZ for several years now. We would stay there again, either as a couples or family getaway, due to the room value and location, but we recognize that it certainly is not a luxury hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Consistent Service and Pleasant Staff”
Reviews.Author: KollegeKlubMadison
Reviews.Content: Overall a very nice stay. The checkin staff were helpful and efficient. Room was the standard Embassy Suite, with ample storage and hanging space. Breakfast was freshly prepared, and the pool was very large. A very good business stay with no hassles.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely Renovated Property”
Reviews.Author: Catalyst_12
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and receptive. The room had a large bedroom, with a front living area with sofa, table, bar and TV. The beds were really comfortable, but the living area of the room was musty. Bathrooms are pretty small. The free omelet breakfast sounded good, but since there was only one short-order cook making breakfasts I opted to skip the line and go for the fresh fruit, oatmeal and yogurt. The lobby, palm trees, ponds, paths and fish looked great. There was a high class mall next door and several top shelf chain restaurants in the local area.

Reviews.Title: “Nicer than the typical Embassy”
Reviews.Author: Ben C
Reviews.Content: Fastest check in ever. Was to my room within 5 minutes of walking onto property (with wife and 2 young kids). Pleasing lobby and pool area. Mall just on the other side of parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: relax2day
Reviews.Content: Although this facility was built 30 years ago, it was totally refurbished about 3 years ago and is very nice. It is located right next to the Biltmore Fashion Mall, which is loaded with nice shops and restaurants. Even though there were several 18U baseball teams staying there, breakfast was still very fast and efficient. They make a great omelet there. The staff was friendly and helfpul as well. Everyone in our group thought it was an excellent place to stay. They have a touch screen assistant in the lobby to direct you to restaurants and shops. However, be cautious. We picked a BBQ place on the north side of town where our friends were staying and it turned out to be a catering only business. My only complaint would be a trash truck next door make beeping and crashing noises at 6 AM.

Reviews.Title: “Wow a real gem”
Reviews.Author: Peter100
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful one night stay here before flying from Phoenix at the end of our vacation. Welcoming staff, a great pool view room and a really really pleasant hotel... The lobby is stunning and the pool area great too. As for the room... All rooms are in fact 2 room suites. We have never had so much space. an amazing touch is the in room brochure where the manager says the staff are instructed to call her at home if there is a problem they can' resolve. The free 2 hour drinks and snacks session every night is great and the breakfast huge and plentiful. I'd definitely come back, well done Embassy Suites Biltmore!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: hexaminer
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night before a departure from Phoenix airport. The hotel is located near some good shops and restaurants and is handy for the airport and city. The staff were very helpful and the complimentary drinks and snacks for two hours at managers reception were welcoming. We ate at the restaurant and I had a nice steak. Rooms are spacious, clean and well presented with free wi fi. We did not use the pool but it looked nice. Would definitely stay again if in the area - really good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great 2 night stay”
Reviews.Author: Emoker
Reviews.Content: Great property beautiful hotel, the koi pond inside has some huge koi, the rooms were huge and ours had a great view of the pool. The managers reception was great Jenna the bartender remembered our names both nights. Breakfast was great too, just wish it lasted till 10am. All in all this was a great stay and would highly recomend this hotel to anyone traveling to the area or for locals that may have family coming to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay & Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: Daniel K
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Embassy Suites on business and had a fantastic stay. The hotel was very clean and the staff was fantastic; very attentive to any requests I may have had. They have a new room called PURE (Hypo Allergenic) rooms that I will definitely request next time I am there. I'm an allergy sufferer and know that next time I stay in the Phoenix Biltmore area I will stay in one of their new PURE rooms. Overall, great stay and I have found my new home.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected...”
Reviews.Author: cchiricos
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the photos posted on-line and the positive reviews. I was not nearly as pleased with the hotel as others were. First night was in a pool side room...way too noisy. Pool is open until midnight so if you are a light sleeper ask for a room away from the pool. Was able to move to a different room and it was much quieter. Based on the photos posted online it looks like some of the rooms have been updated, but the two rooms I stayed in clearly have not been...old bedspreads, worn out carpet (that was never vacuumed during my 4-day stay). The last night of my stay I noticed a lot of outside noise so checked the sliding glass door only to notice it was open. The lock on the door itself did not work and I had a devil of a time making the little extra lock work. Even then the door was still not completely closed. Bathroom pretty small. Lots of "stuff" under the beds...food, papers, razor...yuk!! Workout room very small for such a large hotel...only 2 treadmills and on the first morning one was out of order. On the positive side: front desk staff helpful; breakfast very good. Close to airport, great shopping, and excellent restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but we 'might' be back”
Reviews.Author: JCB57
Reviews.Content: Beautiful lobby, breakfast great, evening manager's reception is ok, so I shouldn't really complain. But the rooms need updating, the curtains were torn, and the bathrooms could be larger. Plus, they charge $8 a night parking - parking that is not covered, not secured, and not really worth it. The internet charge is irritating as well - they charge per day, and there is no way an occasional logon is worth a daily charge of $15. I'll give it above average, and like I said, we might be back.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable accommodations, excellent service, great location, price & reliably good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: marcyro
Reviews.Content: Last minute booking at the Embassy Suites near the Biltmore Resort, Camelback & 26th St. Near shopping, restaurants, recreation. Less than 15 minutes from the airport. The hotel is one of the larger Embassy suites I have visited. Our room was exactly what we expected from an Embassy Suites. The service was excellent, though we really didn't have any demanding issues. There is plenty of convenient parking, though none in the shade. You can walk to all the shopping and restaurants in the Biltmore Fashion Park. You can also walk to the Biltmore Resort, which we did. The daily breakfast was delicious, especially the omelets, french toast, & pancakes. The hotel was quite busy on Saturday, so much so that they could not keep up with the coffee demand. The bed was a tiny bit saggy & lumpy, but I had no trouble sleeping like a baby. The kids loved the place. The atrium is huge and has a very peaceful pond system full of koi that were so tame an playful they let you pet them. From the fifth floor, they almost looked like dolphins. The pool was large, with lots of lounge chairs, towels, tables & chairs. One night, we were too pooped to go out for dinner and reluctantly ate at the hotel restaurant, which pleasantly surprised us as fantastic! Overall, I would easily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best service ever received at any hotel.”
Reviews.Author: pengirl7
Reviews.Content: The staff went out of their way to make this a wonderful experience. They answered any questions/concerned immediately. Everyone smiled and greeted you.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, we'd stay there again anytime”
Reviews.Author: soninatlanta
Reviews.Content: We were there for a convention. The room, one with two dbl beds, was nicely laid out with a bedroom and another room with TV/couch/desk/kitchenette. Beds were comfortable, there was a sink with mirror in the bedroom besides the one in the bathroom which made it convenient for two people. Friendly staff. Architecturally, the open plan of the hotel made it seem less confining when we were attending convention classes and were not free to leave the hotel. The breakfast was great (and Edith makes a mean omlette!); and the hotel restaurant (Omaha Steak House) was very good (try the chocolate cake - unbelieveable!). Also across the street is an open air mall with several other places to eat (the Califormia Pizza Kitchen was very good). It's away from downtown Phoenix, but I would recommend the Biltmore highly.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location... you wont be disappointed!!!”
Reviews.Author: twoincanada
Reviews.Content: Wen't to Phoenix from Canada to see Doctors at the Arazona Heart Institute. Had to rely on internet research to find a hotel and was very pleased with our choice. The people there were great and very very helpful. They even sent the shuttle bus back to the hospital at 9:30 at night to pick us up and bring us back to the hotel after a late release from the hospital. Everything was great and just as advertised. We would certainly stay again and have no problem recommending this hotel to anyone visiting Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel at a great location and price”
Reviews.Author: RonDayton
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here probably a dozen times in the last decade and the staff and the property never disappoint us. Perfect location near a great mall, theater across the street, several different types of restaurants-all good-and the rooms are roomy and well appointed and comfortable. We just came from a Hyatt resort in another city and paid more and got less there. You can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Great for spending some days”
Reviews.Author: Karin-and-Ton
Reviews.Content: Embassy Suites was great as usual. Good breakfast, (omelets made on order)and a nice happy hour (with some nice cocktails). The two rooms are great to stay in. We did notice however that during the weekend a number of locals were staying at the swimmingpool and enjoying the free drinks. And that is something we do not appreciate. Also the outside of the windows were very dirty. There were a lot of cobwebs. Also in room dining was very bad. We only ordered two cups of soup. Half of it was entered on a plate, the remainder in the cup.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel; enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: Jillymae11
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights here while visiting my son in Phoenix. The room was awesome; the free breakfast was delicious; and the atrium area so beautiful! I would have given 5 stars except for the fact that they charge $8/day to park in the hotel parking lot and $14.99/24 hrs to use wireless internet in the room. But I wanted a nicer hotel that still offers smoking rooms, and got that with this hotel. But to say I get a free breakfast and then charge me to park in the parking lot when I have a room reserved there sort of insults my intelligence. But if you don't care to park across the street and walk over or don't care about using internet in your room, it's a sweet deal. I'm not an alcohol drinker so the Manager's Reception in the evenings didn't benefit me. Will probably stay somewhere different next time I make it to Phoenix that offers free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a quick Getaway”
Reviews.Author: dgadwa
Reviews.Content: This was for a quick getaway to get away from the rainy weather in WA and get some sun and shopping in. We stayed 4 nights on a buy 3 get 1 free deal from Vacations to Go. Great Deal as always when it comes to Embassy Suites. Typical room for them included a sitting area with hideaway bed couch, desk and bar area with sink. Micro and fridge are great for an extended stay. Bathroom is seperate from the bedroom so the setup is great for families. The service here was better than the average Embassy Suites. The wait staff learned our names and really made us feel welcome. Right next to an outdoor mall, restaurants, and movie make the location good also.

Reviews.Title: “This place has always been one of the best in phoenix”
Reviews.Author: wfw81658
Reviews.Content: My Wife and were born in phoenix and go back a couple times a year. We have always like the Biltmore because It located the center of phoenix. The hotel has decent rooms that were upgraded not long ago. The dining area is good but, best is the happy hour and having a great pool right out the door. the free breakfast is also good but get there early. Next store is a Capital Grill and Mcormick across the street. Down on 16th north of Camelback is Ajo Al's a decent mexican joint. All Available by their shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Love Embassy Suites & stay there whenever we travel, if possible!”
Reviews.Author: Tampa_FL_Girl
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Phoenix Biltmore Embassy Suites in April at the end of our trip to Arizona & the Grand Canyon. We usually try to stay in Embassy Suites hotels whenever we are traveling with our kids, as we like the extra space, atmosphere and amenities. We arrived at the hotel shortly after 3pm, after driving in several hours from the Grand Canyon. We were disappointed that our room was not ready, even though the stated check-in time for this property is 3pm and we arrived a bit after that time. Though the staff was very nice, courteous & apologetic, we were a bit tired after our long drive & had wanted to check in & freshen up prior to going to a local MLB baseball game. We were told it would not be too long until our room was ready & that they would call our cell phone when it was. Our boys amused themselves by feeding the fish in the Koi pond (you can get the food from the front desk to feed them); however, we got a bit tired of waiting around, and decided to go across the street to the outdoor mall to eat (Cheesecake Factory). We were finally called (after 5pm!) to tell us our room was ready, which was a bit of an inconvenience as it made it difficult for us to attend the ballgame (w/a start time of 6:40pm), as once we got settled in to our room, it was a bit late to try to head out for that. This made our boys a bit upset. However, we were able to attend & enjoy the Manager's reception & the bartender that evening was really great (I don't recall her name, but she was wonderful). Our room was nice & typical of Embassy Suites, w/comfy beds, nice bathroom, in room coffee maker & fridge, etc. We all really enjoyed breakfast the following morning, with many choices for breakfast including made-to-order omelets, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, hot & cold cereals, breads, etc. A very good selection indeed! We also liked that there was a 'business center' which we could use to print our airline boarding passes :) We did not get a chance to use the pool, but the pool area looked very nice. Overall, we enjoyed our short stay, but wish that our check-in process had a been a bit smoother. We will definitely stay at Embassy Suites in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Suites of Excellence”
Reviews.Author: aaw775
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Biltmore Embassy Suites in Phoenix and can’t wait to go back. This was my first time staying at an Embassy Suites and the experience was awesome. When I checked in I was greeted with smiles and Hello’s. The woman at the desk was very helpful and nice, also made check in very fast. The room was very clean and the air conditioning was on which I appreciated because it was really warm in Phoenix. My wife and I attended the open bar happy hour which was awesome; I don’t think any other hotels offer something like that. We had room service which was great. The food was very good and the delivery was fast. We also got to swim in the pool which was fun, clean and had plenty of towels. When it was time to sleep the room and atmosphere was quite which made it easy to fall asleep in the most comfortable bed ever. The morning breakfast was awesome. I was like going to a restaurant to eat. The food was cooked to order and tasted very good. Overall the service was great, awesome, and terrific.

Reviews.Title: “A good place for a long stay”
Reviews.Author: kkhart
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 4 nights here -my first at an Embassy Suites. The staff was terrific. Every single employee I encountered was friendly and helpful. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. It was great having the extra room to spread out and relax, especially for a longer stay. I liked the atrium and the fish ponds. The waterfall could get a little loud, but didn't bother my sleep. The morning breakfast was very plentiful and varied. It was kept well stocked with fresh fruit, yogurt, coffee, and breads - plus the cooked to order omelets and sides of potatoes and breakfast meats. A great way to start the day. The manager's reception was a nice surprise - complementary cocktails and trays of fresh veggies, hummus and the best pita chips I have had. I only got to use the pool once, but it is bigger then the photos and the landscaping is pleasant. There is also a good Jacuzzi. As others have noted, the plumbing is a little weird – my shower ran hot then cold. The toilet would randomly start running – usually in the middle of the night. I did call and someone came up to work on it right away, and it got better, but was not completely resolved. I would certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice property with some issues”
Reviews.Author: jfd
Reviews.Content: Beautiful for an Embassy Suites, lovely atrium and very nice pool. We were upgraded to a pool view with a very large terrace. The room has 2 flat screen TVs, refrigerator, but a small bathroom. The door to the bedroom was off the hinges with bent screws, and the screen door to the terrace had a broken latch and was filthy. The air conditioner was very noisy and woke us up throughout the night, In the morning there were a fews screaming kids in the pool at 8am. We did not have to pay for parking and had free internet. The breakfast and happy hour were typical of other Embassy properties. The location was great with lots of shops and restaurants nearby. We were visiting our daughter nearby so the location was most important to us. The facility had a neat see through gym and also had laundramats.

Reviews.Title: “Special Celebration”
Reviews.Author: KLKDO
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and accomodating. Chuck Benshoot especially went above and beyond to ensure my sisters birthday weekend would be unforgetable. The pool area was wonderful; partially shaded to avoid a sunburn. The location is superb; we were able to walk to great restaurants and shopping. Very upscale!

Reviews.Title: “50th birthday Stayvacation Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: debbieandpatc
Reviews.Content: My three sisters and cousin chose Embassy Suites Biltmore to gather an celebrate our youngest sisters 50th birthday. It was fabulous. The Managers Happy Hour and breakfasts included in the package were amazing. We really enjoyed the rooms and pool. Chuck Benshoof, maintenance engineer, really helped make our stay "over the top". The refringerator in our room was not working when we arrived and Chuck replaced it and also brought us a second refrigerator along with a tub to ice down our beers. He checked in with us throughtout our stay to see that we had everything we needed. He really went "above and beyond" his duties to make our visit very pleasurable. People like Chuck, make this a "world Class" Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: SuziT9
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at a lot of Embassy Suites, including several in the Phoenix area, and this is one of our favorites. The location can't be beat, with a mall and movie theatre within walking distance, plus easy access to many great sites in Phoenix. The atrium is among the most beautiful we've seen, complete with the requisite giant koy, plants and walkways. The staff were kind about giving fish food to our kids. Our room was just fine, although I really wish ESuites would put the door to the bathroom OUTSIDE of the master bedroom, so you can close the door to the bedroom and others (kids on the sofa bed) can get to the bathroom without coming in. Oh well. The sofa bed, unfortunately, was quite uncomfortable, even for a sofa bed and even for a kid. Because we were on the first floor and near to the morning breakfast area, the sounds of dishes in the morning woke people up early. (The bedroom was lovely, dark and quiet, so if you're not on the sofa bed, no worries). The staff were friendly and helpful; the housekeepers came and went without intruding. The breakfast was nice, but with the usual long ESuites lines. However, the staff put out hot breakfast items on a buffet, so you could still get a nice breakfast without waiting in line. Several tables were available outside by the pool. I have to say the managers' receptions have declined in recent years, or maybe it's just our last few stays. But, it seemed like you used to get decent appetizers; now it just seems to be nacho cheese and popcorn. We didn't even bother going any of the nights--the food is pretty junky. The pool area was nice with plenty of tables and chairs for sunning. The pool was quite cold this time of year, though! All in all, this was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place, weird Showers.”
Reviews.Author: Pamela-and-Greg
Reviews.Content: We like Embassy Suites and try to stay there whenever possible. The Biltmore Embassy suites did not disappoint. The location was great, next to the Biltmore Mall. The property looked great and was well maintained. Check-in was fast and efficent. The room was clean and well stocked. The atrium is very nice with the ponds and fish and even turtles. The pool area was very nice, could have been better placed for sunbathing but otherwise very nice. The only bad thing I have to say about the property is their showers. We had a room with a shower that went from hot to cold while you were in the shower. We called the front desk and they sent someone up right away to fix it. The fix however did not work so we were given another room. Our other room did the same as the first room but not to the degree of the first room. It seems that they could update their bath faucets. We liked the service at the bar, Alan, Ben and Alexandra did a great job for us. The Managers reception was pretty typical of Embassy suites, not real great food and low quality drinks and of course long lines but that is normal. Breakfast was pretty good. We liked the Embassy Biltmore and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Extra Charges detract from experience”
Reviews.Author: wetbaloney
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property, in a great location. It has a lovely atrium, great complimentary breakfast, free happy hour, and nice rooms. But...can you believe??? -- THEY CHARGE FOR WIFI. This very basic component of any contemporary hotel stay is not provided free, even in the lobby. They charge you $14 per day to connect to their network (which is a very slow one at that). This is insane. Even most $40/night flophouse motels now give free wifi, not to mention McDonalds and Starbucks. Also, I've stayed at many other Hilton properties and have never had a charge for WiFi. What are these people thinking???? Next bad surprise -- they charge $7/day for parking. Hey -- this is not a big city hotel smack in the middle of the central business district. This is in an outlying shopping/business area, about 7 miles from downtown Phoenix, across the street from a shopping mall. When I book at a "suites" type of property, I am thinking "upscale motel". I'm looking for comfort and convenience. Pay-to-park does not fit with my idea of convenience -- does it with yours? If the owners of this property (Hilton I assume) need to get a certain amount of revenue to support the business, then they should set their rates appropriately rather than hit their guests with all of these extra charges for services which should be included in the basic package.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous property and staff was excellent!”
Reviews.Author: cfd88
Reviews.Content: We hosted our annual meeting at this property. The hotel was beautiful and had great amenities with the size of the room and Manager's cocktail reception. The staff were all excellent and very accommodating to our requests and assisting our members (and remembered our names). They helped us find great restaurants in the area. All of the food for our meeting was great. Hotel rooms were very clean. It was great to see the cleaning staff remove all glasses and bed linens for the next guests. If you like quiet when you are sleeping, I recommend you request a room that is not poolside, as the pool is open late.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and price”
Reviews.Author: alibeth
Reviews.Content: For our purposes to visit Arizona State University we were very well located. Embassy suites will put you in a position to go anywhere in Phoenix. It's location by a mall gave us a lot of choices for dining, especially the Cheesecake Factory which I love. It's also 10 minutes drive to Scottsdale Fashion mall. The carpets were a little worn because of the swimming pool use. But rooms were nice and spacious being suites. Mostly business clientelle here. The restaurant, Omaha Steaks, located in the hotel arranged a dinner for 20 people very quickly. With only one server they did a great job.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice four young family”
Reviews.Author: uncletravelinmatt
Reviews.Content: We joined my husband on a business trip. We were able to get around to the Fashion Plaza by walking, there are some nice shops & dining choices. We enjoyed our breakfast each morning. The kids enjoyed the heated pool. We like having the extra TV room to play & stretch out in. The place was clean and updated. The kids loved the koi ponds. The property was well maintained. I didn't use the work out room but it did look nice. I was surprised that just around the corner from the Biltmore area is such a run down neighborhood. The traffic was heavy because of a lot of street repairs.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like a resort without the high price tag.”
Reviews.Author: Bajabundo
Reviews.Content: We used the Embassy Suites Phoenix Biltmore for our Oct/2010 Family Reunion. The accommodations were wonderful and all rooms are suites in this hotel. The lobby is a beautiful place to meet and hang out. The "cooked-to-order" complimentary breakfast was absolutely delicious. Three generations enjoyed the large heated pool and hot tub. During the evening the hotel serves complimentary beverages and snacks in their lobby and our family enjoyed the time to visit and also took advantage of the large screen tvs since it was football season. The hotel is in a beautiful and established part of Phoenix and is close to shopping and attractions. The group sales manager, Ms. Salinas, was happy to provide us with an extensive list of area attractions. Our family throughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Atrium”
Reviews.Author: AggieDiver86
Reviews.Content: If you like Embassy Suites, you are in for a treat. Beautiful and huge atrium with palm trees, running stream with waterfalls, koi fish, and turtles. Pool is great. Suites are very clean and typical for Embassy Suites high standards. Steak restaurant was fantastic. Typical Embassy Suites full breakfast, evening drinks and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - good location - problems with breakfast”
Reviews.Author: l0vebug
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - nice, comfortable, large, clean rooms. Location is great - good in the business area and restaurants and shopping within walking distance. The only downfall I have is the breakfast line in the mornings. It is not set-up well and I had to stand in line for 30 minutes to get the buffet-type, ready to eat food. The reason the line was so long was because it's only one line for ready to eat and cook to order food. So you had to wait in line for cook to order, even if you did not want it. It was ridiculous. Other than that, super nice hotel and highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Big Room, Friendly Staff, Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Saluga
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel. At check-in we were greeted by a friendly clerk, who was very helpful with directions to shopping and restaurants. Our suite was clean and spacious – much bigger than the suites at other Embassy Suites that we’ve stayed at – with a very nice modern décor. There was a sink and vanity in the bedroom, as well as in the bathroom. The atrium was very pretty, with floor to ceiling windows overlooking the pool, a pond with goldfish, and a waterfall. The fitness room had a few treadmills, an exercise bike, and free weights. The business center had two computers and a printer, which was handy for printing out boarding passes. Breakfast was complimentary and served in the atrium. The woman who cooked the hot items gave me two pancakes that were almost as big as the dish that they were on. The hotel is within walking distance of the Biltmore shopping center, which had shops and restaurants. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and food service”
Reviews.Author: DaveMechanicsburg_PA
Reviews.Content: It was a typical Embassy Suites in many ways. The location is terrific, within walking distance of a fashion mall and many restaurants. Room carpet was dirty, but otherwise OK. Breakfast prep staff was outstanding. Eddie the shuttle driver was very personable and helpful. Front desk was accommodating. Outdoor pool was large, landscaped and clean enough. A very good option for Phoenix, and I would recommend highly for a business meeting. Our event planner arranged for airport transportation, not otherwise offered.

Reviews.Title: “Better suited for a business trip than as part of a vacation”
Reviews.Author: yankeegirl13
Reviews.Content: I have waited a few weeks before writing this review because I wanted to be sure that it was honest and thought that time might help. We checked into this hotel around midnight with a confirmed reservation for a King Suite for a two night stay. Check-in was fine and the agent on staff was cordial. After getting to our room (which was the furthest room possible away from the lobby) I saw that it was two double beds. I walked back down to the lobby to ask about our room and was told that they were out of king rooms because we checked in too late. There was a half hearted apology but no solution other than to come back tomorrow to see if there might be a king room available. The next morning (after a good nights sleep) we decided that since we were leaving the following morning we would just make due in the double room rather than move all our stuff. We were going to be in Arizona for eight days and had three more hotels to go to after this one. Breakfast is always the best part of staying at an Embassy and in this area they did not disappoint. The chef was very friendly - she made the BEST french toast! After breakfast we thought we'd go swimming but unfortunately the pool looked as though it hadn't been cleaned in two days and was full of leaves and bugs. Location on Camelback is good. Shopping is right across the way and you're only a few miles from Old Town Scottsdale. Overall the hotel was fine for the short time we stayed there. If returning to Phoenix for business this would be on the list however for a leisure vacation you're better off at Hilton Tapatio Cliffs or Squaw Peak.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Air Conditioning”
Reviews.Author: MikeBSanMarcos_Texas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night before returning home from vacation. We rented two rooms. The air condtioning was horrible. Never got below 78 degrees the whole night. I would not reccomend staying here in the heat of the summer

Reviews.Title: “So..so”
Reviews.Author: longing4maui
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times over the years and have sadly watched the condition of the hotel go down.....the managers reception and morning breakfast are sub standard compared to years past. I would only suggest staying here if it suits your business needs. We were also charged for parking in an open parking lot....

Reviews.Title: “OK but not great”
Reviews.Author: MikeyR
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for almost a week, overall our stay was ok. The location of the hotel is a big plus, the amenities of the hotel are also OK. But you can't help but feel that the hotel is bland and a bit tired. The rooms are reasonably clean, but if you look hard enough, its only on the surface. The fact that WiFi is $15/day is excessive, and the room service menu is also out of touch. Nice having a washer/dryer in the hotel. The cleaning/housekeeping crew were a bit aggressive, one day we were told that the room has to be cleaned now, and when we asked for a few minutes to leave, the cleaning person stood by the door and was quite pushy. I would recommend this place for a few days, but next time I will probably search for alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “When in Phoenix....only stay here !”
Reviews.Author: tim805
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights with my wife and 13 year old son. Check in was quick and the staff was very welcoming and made us feel right at home. Assigned a nice 4th floor room overlooking the pool. The interior of the hotel is beautiful with flowing ponds and lots of places to sit and relax. The room was very nice and clean and included a big living room with a connecting bedroom. More than enough room for all of us. In the evening they had happy hour along with healthy snacks. Breakfast included a lot of choices and again was presented in the beautiful atrium. Each morning the front desk provided a cup full of koi food that our son used to feed the fish and turtles. We used the the pool both days and our son kept saying this was his favorite hotel of our 6 day trip in Arizona. Overall, the staff was really nice and helpful with directions and the rooms were terrific. My family really enjoyed our stay in Phoenix and this hotel had a lot to due with it.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty room”
Reviews.Author: VMunoz312
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the Embassy Suites (Biltmore) on 7/3/10 for our two day stay. Since it was a last minute reservation, I did understand and being a Gold HH member we would not get a great room. We had initially checked into the Embassy Suites in Tempe, Az with advance reservations, but our room was not cleaned and smelled like cigarette. We checked out immediately and asked the representative to make reservations at the Biltmore since we have stayed several times in the past and love it there. However this time was a little different. We were given room #512 and the floors were not vacuumed, shower drain was clogged, bathroom door would not lock (at one point my daughter was locked in the restroom), room smelled like mold and carpet in the bedroom was not tacked down properly which is a safety hazard since there were exposed wires/cables for the television. I contacted the front desk and a housekeeping manager arrived to our room. I explained the issues and in which she stated "What do you want me to do?" I was amazed that she responded in that way and just told her nothing. I notified on duty manager Joy on 7/4/10, who assisted me in this issue and told me she would have a technician check the room and one night would be refunded to us for the inconvenience. Upon our arrival that night (9 pm), I noticed our room had a welcome box with a technician's notes stating all issues were resolved, however that was not the case. I contacted the front desk and spoke to Daisy who assisted me in coming to our room and witnessing nothing was resolved by the technician. I contacted a female duty manager on 7/5/10 and advised her of the situation and also told her Daisy had been a witness to the issue. The on duty manager also refunded our money for the 2nd night, and apologized for the issues. I want to first of all thank the Embassy Suite staff for a great job in assisting us regarding these issues. The housekeeping manager was no help at all and could not offer any solution. I housekeeping reads this review since they need major improvements!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not the typical Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ericfaust
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. The inside is a large atrium so you are not just walking through hallways to get to your room. Plus the free breakfast is the real thing. Eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes, and made to order omelets all free and delicious!! Then to top it off they have a free happy hour around 5 o' clock. The only thing this hotel could improve on would be cheaper internet. The rate is $15 a day, this should be either free or no more than $10 a day. All in all great hotel at a great location. and if you like flavored Margaritas be sure to go to Arribas just down the road. Huge and delicious Margaritas there.

Reviews.Title: “Great informal gathering place.”
Reviews.Author: Stfanny
Reviews.Content: We had an informal reunion of about 40 people. The atrium was a perfect informal setting and the hotel staff bent over backwards to accomodate our needs. I highly recommend the hotel for informal summer gathering in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “This is the Best Hotel That I have eve stayed at”
Reviews.Author: garveyt
Reviews.Content: My Vietnam Veteran Reunion (Charlie Battery 1st/40th Vietnam Veterans 1966-68) was held at the Embassy Suites Phoenix Biltmore Hotel from April 25-30, 2010. I cannot express how wonderful the rooms, staff, food, friendly atmosphere and the whole environment contributed to the success of our reunion - it was just great. I would like to particularly like to thank Ms. Janice Yates, Sales Manager and Ms. Claudine Sanchez, Director, Food and Beverage with the Embassy Suites Phoenix Biltmore for their kindness and sensitivity to a group of war weary Vietnam Veterans - great job.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: SandiSilva
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here and attended a conference. The rooms were comfortable, quiet and very nice. The main areas were pretty, and the conference area was perfect for our group. All of the food was far above average and not the typical hotel food. Service and staff were outstanding. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Best, most relaxing home away from home ever”
Reviews.Author: JanetJanowiak
Reviews.Content: Excellent suites, pool open until midnight! Free build-your-own-omelet breakfast and manager's reception!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Just ..... wow!”
Reviews.Author: DanaFortier
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based on a site inspection by one of our association members and trusted that opinion. But - we were unprepared for how spectacular it actually is in person! For starters, the atrium is simply awe inspiring. I don't think I ever want to stay in another hotel with those closed off hallways, but I don't think there's anyway around that. Every hotel needs to model itself after this one. The staff is simply amazing. We were there for our annual conference. Over 100 people, mostly female, who are close online and only see each other once a year, so it was like a sorority reunion and business conference all in one. We thought they'd get tired of the squealing and hugging and so forth, but they all said it was "cute"!! The meeting space was always clean, well lit and very well set up. The catering staff went over and above (Fidel - this means you!!) when we asked for anything. The sleeping rooms are comfortable and VERY roomy. I especially loved that we had plenty of space in our room to move! At one point we had 18 people in our room for a late night business discussion/pajama party and we weren't crowded. The beds are comfortable and the pillows were perfect for me. The food - breakfast buffet was terrific. I love making a hashbrown casserole, and they had all of the components to put it together for me every morning, except for my last day when I wanted French Toast, which they made with cinnamon on it for me. We had lunches from the catering department - and those were terrific. Overall - I didn't want to leave! From the friendliness to the food to the comfort, its well worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “OK for business with some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: Comitis
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week on business. We held our training classes in the hotel as well so I experienced all the "amenities". Good: complimentary breakfast, nightly happy hour. Nice interior courtyard, Koi-pond and quaint bridges; onsite Omaha Steak House restaurant had great food. Pool was very nice and hot tub was located in a little niche. Location was directly across the street from a shopping mall and variety of restaurants. Bad: rooms are not updated, smell moldy, old carpet, and I had a leak coming from the ceiling outside my bathroom onto the carpet (but it was fixed immediately reported). They seemed to be having some maintenance issues, sewer smell from public restroom and one elevator was shutdown. Some concerns with security were reported by colleagues, re non-housekeeping staff entering rooms. I did not have this experience. Overall, an older property that needs updating, but okay for business travel/conferences; and for families/pets. I would not recommend it if you want an upscale experience.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, A Few Issues”
Reviews.Author: Libguppy
Reviews.Content: I booked at the Embassy for an HHonors award on our way to San Diego. Out of the 3 Hilton properties we stayed at, this one contained better dressed people, more formal desk help and a more formal atmosphere. Not saying these things were better or worse, just a different impression than the other 2 hotels in smaller towns and not the Biltmore district. The hotel itself is lovely in the lobby. Our 2 yr. old son loved the koi fish in the ponds and the glass elevators so much he wouldn't stop to eat his breakfast the next day. The 1BDRM suite was comfortable for the 3 of us. I was a little nervous about him opening the door so we put the ottoman in front of it. Check in and check out were both easy and quick. I did not like the $8 self parking fee or the internet charge. Also have to watch on weekends about people holding wedding receptions and social functions at this hotel. It can get noisy if you have an interior room on the first floor like we did. The hot part of breakfast started a little later than we wanted... we like to get on the road if we've got more driving to do. Just FYI, plot out your maps for Phoenix and have alternatives in mind. It's not the easiest city to get around and there was construction here and there that made it even more difficult. Also, this hotel is easy to miss, especially if you use a Google map as it's labeled wrong. The Biltmore Fashion Park is right across the street with good shopping and a Cheesecake Factory. All in all a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Training trip”
Reviews.Author: springtrainer
Reviews.Content: I had a group of 12 friends fly to Phoenix for a golf and baseball trip. The rooms worked out well with 2 queen size beds and a sofa bed. The cooked to order omelets were great as well as the French toast. The service at the hotel stood out. Nanci took care of us by making suggestions as well as reservations for restaurants in the area. Nanci always had a smile on her face. The free drinks every evening was a plus as well. The next time I am in Phoenix I plan on staying here again. Mike

Reviews.Title: “Love the Koi Pond!”
Reviews.Author: Radiant360
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed staying here last year and look forward to my stay this year. Their staff is ultra-friendly and helpful. Nice, clean rooms and wonderful breakfasts. Location is superb for those who don't wish to drive around a strange city. Shopping and dining choices are a few feet away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and Big and New”
Reviews.Author: vita-brevis
Reviews.Content: Came for a business trip. For a very reasonable rate, I had a huge comfortable bed with six pillows (!), a sitting room, fridge, microwave, 2 TV's, a pullout couch in a separate room... so as a mom, I see a two bedroom suite. There is a nice-looking pool. Free breakfast, including eggs to order, and 2-hour free happy hour each day. The high-end mall is literally next door with restaurants and great stores (Chicos, Brooks Brothers, etc). And 10 minutes from airport. Wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Phoenix with great shopping next door”
Reviews.Author: JasonSS
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business meeting. Rooms were well-appointed and spacious. Meeting rooms were standard. Hotel is conveniently located to major thoroughfares in the city. Easy to get to Scottsdale and other neighboring towns. Staff was helpful. Fitness center was a bit cramped and I was looking for a bit more equipment. No additional charge was a plus. Charge for parking seemed a bit crazy as it's an open lot.

Reviews.Title: “Not far from Scottsdale. Right next to Biltmore Fashion Park (a mall). Great happy hour and breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: mikelahr
Reviews.Content: Although it isn't all that close to center Phoenix or the airport, this Embassy Suites is no more than 20 minutes from either. It is literally right across from the Biltmore Fashion Park. It is also walking distance from two great restaurants in a Morton's Steakhouse and Houstons. A full breakfast was included with the room, and each (weekday?) night from 5:30 -7:30 PM the hotel offers free drinks to its guests. Best of all, the hotel has a shuttle bus that will take guests to and from locales of their choosing. I was at the hotel for a workshop (meeting rooms are small but very nice), and some of my colleagues asked to be driven to Camelback Mountain for a hike. We also were driven to an Italian restaurant called Tomaso's, which was some of the best Italian food I have ever had (and I'm from NJ).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cantforgetparis
Reviews.Content: I travel often for business and found this hotel to be of high quality. I had rude service over the phone when making my reservation and hesitated about staying here but was attending a conference in the hotel. My stay ended up to be fantastic. I had very friendly service from the front desk staff to housekeeping to the shuttle driver, a complimentary service of the hotel. There are many places within walking distance to both shop and eat. I will stay here again when in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “No air circulation; lost reservation”
Reviews.Author: Mustang70
Reviews.Content: The room was large and the bed comfortable, however, the service and temperature left something to be desired. When I arrived, the person at the front desk couldn't find my reservation and didn't seem very interested in resolving this or keeping my business. I went elsewhere in the lobby to unsuccessfully search my email for a confirmation, then went back to the desk to give it another shot. A second person looked for the reservation and still couldn't find it. To be fair to these employees, I really think that there was a system problem of some sort. However, I would have expected them to, in a friendly manner, look for available rooms for me rather than just look blank at the fact that I didn't have a reservation. (Upon my inquiry, there were available rooms and I was able to check in.) By the way, I called the sales department in the morning to get my rate adjusted and was told that my original reservation was in there! My second issue was with the temperature in my room. It was pretty stuffy when I checked in and I couldn't get any kind of air or fan to kick on. Fortunately, the window (balcony door) opened and it was a cool December day for Phoenix. Since I was staying alone, I wanted to close up when I went to bed that night, so I called the front desk who informed me that the hotel was "on neutral," but they could bring a box fan up to my room. I ended up sleeping each night with the window cracked and the fan on low to keep the air circulating. At least I felt very green! I really like the Embassy Suites layout and the breakfast, but can't recommend this particular one.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel! 11 on a scale of 1 to 10!”
Reviews.Author: MichiganSal
Reviews.Content: Came to Phoenix a couple days prior to a conference for work. What a magnificient hotel. 3 sink areas with mirrors allowing multiple people to get ready. 2 huge tv's. Clean, modern rooms. The free cooked-to-order breakfast and free happy hour where outstanding. The staff was fabulous. The pool and hot-tub were rejuvenating. The location is convenient to tons of shopping. Then we moved to the over-priced Fairmont Scottsdale Princess where they have small rooms, staff walking around with their hand out waiting for a tip, and located next to nothing. I would definitely recommend the Embassy Suites Phoenix Biltmore Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel & Location - Great for Golf”
Reviews.Author: ludiandrade
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Embassy Suites Biltmore in Phoenix the weekend of Aug 28 for 2 nights. The location of this property is excellent for shopping (Shopping center right across parking lot - includes The Cheescake Factory. - and golf at the Biltmore Golf Course. Embassy Suites provides a shuttle to the golf course. Property is clean. Rooms are clean. Breakfast, as always,was excellent. Only concern is the $6.00 per day for parking. It is not covered nor valet parking but a regular hotel parking that is also shared with Omaha Steakhouse that is located in the hotel. This charge should be removed. We frequent Embassy Suites as their properties are usually located in safe neighborhoods and provide excellent service (with the exception of LAX Airport property- see my review Jan2009) for which the management immediately contacted us to resolve our dissatisfaction. I certainly recommend this hotel for either business or leisure. We will be returning in early November for a one night layover from a european trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: davidbViennaVA
Reviews.Content: My family loves to stay at Embassy Suites and this one did not disappoint. Very nice atrium, clean rooms, 2 TVs (kids were thrilled). The usual great breakfast. The manager's reception was disappointing compared to others but we were meeting people for dinner anyway so all we really wanted was a free drink. The pool was very ncie (and warm) but there was some leaves and bugs in the water, though not enough to keep us out of the water when it was 107 in the shade! I tried to talk the desk clerk out of the $6 parkign fee but was not successful. Since the room was only $79, I decided I could afford the $6. The hotel is next door to an upscale shopping mall and about 20 minutes from the airport and well-located to downtown and Scottsdale.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Great Price. Great Stay.”
Reviews.Author: CableOne
Reviews.Content: With over 50 of my associates staying at the Embassy Suites Phoenix Biltmore for a week's conference, which included meals, there were no complaints only rave reviews. The Embassy staff goes out of their way to make sure your stay is a pleasant experience. Would definitely stay there again. P.S. You must try their delicious cookies.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are nice, Breakfast OK”
Reviews.Author: TribeFanCleveland
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night last month before departing Phoenix after a week in AZ: *Rooms seemed to have been renovated in the last year or two so all the furniture is new and modern. New 37" flat panel LCD TV are nice. *Breakfast is of course "free" as with all Embassy Suites Hotels, but their set up has much to be desired. Other Embassy's offer scrambled eggs, bacon and potatoes and other items that is self serve. Here you have to wait in line for everything. The only items that are self serve are cereal and pastries. Give yourself plenty of time as the line moved slowly on the morning we where there. *If they ask if you have a car tell them no... They charge $6 per night for parking in an open lot. There is also a large open lot across the access road behind Biltmore Mall. *The pool seemed nice, alhough we did not utilize it due to the short stay. *Biltmore Mall offers many nice dinning options for dinner. We ate at Sam's Cafe, which offers a great Southwester menu. Great stay overall and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a/c was weak and room showed age”
Reviews.Author: alexnova
Reviews.Content: The hotel's atrium is expansive and impressive. Check-in was no problem. I had a room on the top floor overlooking the pool. As the title states, I felt that the a/c in the room was inadequate. I turned it down to its lowest setting of 60F and I'm very sure that it never reached anywhere near that temperature. I woke up each morning sweating; in order for the room to get cold, I had to close the curtains, which I hated to do since I like my room bathed in sunlight. Also, the shower head was loose and coming off the wall. Of course, the cook-to-order breakfast and manager's hour every evening was enjoyable. I'd stay there again for the location and service, but would not ask for Rm 547 again.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place to stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dwakla
Reviews.Content: I do not normally write reviews after staying at a hotel but, I felt compelled to write one for this hotel. This is a wonderful hotel! The staff was very attentive and cordial. They went out of their way to make sure that you were comfortable. This is also a great hotel for a family. The outdoor pool is large enough to accommodate many without feeling crowded. The hot tub is located in a secluded area surrounded by palm trees. The food was good. The chocolate cake is to die for. (seriously). This hotel is located in a great spot. There are several shopping strip malls within walking distance. We were able to walk to the Cheesecake Factory for dinner. I will never forget the time that I spent at this hotel and I cannot wait until I return again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: SpicynShellie
Reviews.Content: The Embassy Suites at The Biltmore is an excellent location and my stay was very good. Room was very large and spotless. Housekeeping was attentive to details although I had to ask twice for a robe. Front Desk Agent, Nancy was very welcoming and friendly. Breakfast was okay but coffee was terrible to my taste. They do have a Starbucks outlet on property but it wasn't open on Saturday or Sunday. Manager's cocktail party was also okay but I've had better snack options at other Embassy Suites. Popcorn, pretzels, and a mixed snack option were offered. The location is ideal right next to the Arizona Biltmore Shopping Center. Spa services at Elizabeth Arden Red Door Spa outstanding and you can get a 15% discount on services if you stay at the Embassy Suites. My room was quiet and comfortable. Towels, amenities, and glassware were plentiful. The bed was very comfortable. The restaurants and shopping at the Biltmore are amazing. You can also take the beautiful underground pedestrian walk way under Camelback Road to the Esplanade across the street without having to battle the traffic. Had a delightful coffee outdoors at Starbucks near the Ritz Carlton. You can't go wrong with the location. Hotel offers complimentary transportation within 5 miles of the hotel although I didn't see mention of this in the room collateral.

Reviews.Title: “Typical, fairly good Embassy Suites experience”
Reviews.Author: afrinl
Reviews.Content: My family (wife, two tweens, and mother) stayed at the Biltmore Embassy Suites in Phoenix for two nights in December 2008 at the beginning of a big winter road trip vacation swinging from the Southwest through the mid-West. In general, it was a standard Embassy Suites experience -- that is to say, a fairly good experience -- with the exception of the air-handling problem mentioned in the previous review. It seems the hotel's entire air-handling system is switched either to cooling or heating (which in itself is not odd), but if the hotel's system is set one way, you cannot achieve the opposite effect in your room no matter how you set the room's thermostat. Thus, we found our rooms uncomfortably warm but could cool them only by opening the sliding glass doors to the outside. Otherwise, it was a good stay. The front desk staff and breakfast staff were pleasant and helpful, and the breakfasts were quite tasty and filling.

Reviews.Title: “nice chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: Simplycuban
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel while in town for SHPE{ society of hispanic professional engineers}.great location,next to a great mall with several restaurants nearby. Clean and well kept. 2 mildly annoying problems. The air sytem in the hotel is either off or on.At the time we stayed there it was off. Unless you opened the sliding door you had no air circulating in your room. We were on the top floor so we did just that, but for those on the ground floor that wasn't an option as that would be unsafe. I prefer that the rooms have individual control,again a minor thing. The front desk had no knowledge of other places in the immediate area for shopping, spa services etc. I think that this is something that could be easily remedied. Over all it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: blondegal57
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival of the hotel we were greeted by very happy desk clerks. My son had picked us up at the airport, we flew in from Fresno Ca., and he had his two children with him. My daughter was with us and she had her child with her also. Before we were checked in, the doorman had taken my grandchildren, with permission , to get fish food to feed the Koi in the pond at the Atrium. They loved it. That was very nice. We went to our room, third floor , in a glass elevator...loved the view of the Atrium and the Koi pond. Beautiful decor. Large painted mural on the wall.
